titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush V1992.006
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:51 +0000.

did.unittitle: Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush

physdesc.extent: two items housed in one folder.

did.abstract: The Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush consist of two black-and-white mounted photographic prints showing classes at P. S. 139, located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1915.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush consist of two black-and-white mounted photographic prints showing classes at P. S. 139, located in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn, circa 1915. Both photographs include notes on the verso identifying the school and its location. One photograph includes a handwritten note on the verso naming "Mordorf" as principal and also names "Marta Boderstrom Riedemann," presumably a student in the photograph.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date range of this collection, the photographs will enter the public domain in 2035. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection cannot be verified. There is some evidence that it was either donated or purchased from Brooklyn Union Gas. The collection was formally accessioned in 1992.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Group portrait photographs of classes at P.S. 139 in Flatbush, V1992.006, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: P.S. 139 is located at 330 Rugby Road (near Cortelyou) in the Flatbush neighborhood of Brooklyn. In 1915, Oliver C. Mordorf served as principal of the school.
